name: Georgian Court Bed & Breakfast Guest House

reviews.text: Spent 4 nights in this great bed and breakfast. Staff really helpful and friendly. Interesting room, queen bed plus two singles just for me, ensuite, kettle, plenty of wardrobe and drawer space. Bed firm. The room is quiet as its just off the main part of the city, you can just hear the train in the distance. 5 mins walk to tram to city, or 20 minutes walk through park to city.
reviews.title: Really good experience

likes.disliked: — The bed was a bit firm for my comfort.

reviews.title: Melbourne Cup Carnival
reviews.text: Internet available, as is payphone. You can also use the laundry if you wish to.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfasts full of variety and very filling. I would certainly recommend this place and would return. Bear in mind its a 150 year old house, not a modern purpose built hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hospitality with a Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in three single ensuite rooms for the Melbourne Cup Carnival. We had a fabulous time, really enjoyed Melbourne. Georgian Court was located in a quite leafy street only 2 minutes walk to the tram. Skybus delivers you right to the door and fabulous shopping is a 1 minute tram ride away. Local shops are literally around the corner - chemist, fruitshop, restaurant (x3). This is simply the perfect location for visiting Melbourne.
reviews.title: A little bit tired around the edges

reviews.text: The 3 star rooms are quiet , clean and comfortable - not large but adequate room for one person yet each had a surprisingly large and newish ensuite bathroom. (Most of the time we were out and about anyway so who needs to waste money on room size). The furniture and bedroom fittings are older style and you could say tired but everything works well and its all there.
reviews.title: What a lovely welcome!

reviews.text: If you are on a budget, like the B&B experience, and want to be close to the action in Melbourne, this is a very friendly accomodation. The host and hostesses are very helpful.
reviews.title: Great Location, Value Accomodation
Very welcoming
reviews.text: The place is typical of 3 star accomodations, that is to say a bit worn, a bit small, a bit noisy... so if you are looking for the Ritz, this aint it.

reviews.title: Great Breakfast
reviews.text: The breakfast is not at all great: basically, your choice of several cold cereals, juice, lots and lots of bread and jams, and canned fruit. No problem with quantity, but... if breakfast is the most important meal in your day, eat out.

Location was okay, short tram ride to city centre but the whole place was very shabby and worn looking. Our twin bed room was tiny, and we could hardly move with our suitcases in there. There was one hard chair for the two of us. There was no room for bedside tables so lamps were balanced on small shelves over the bed, with the wires hanging down - very dangerous as you could easily pull the lamp on top of your head in the night! The bathroom was more modern and was clean. Breakfast was ok but nothing special. Seems to be overpriced for this standard. Would definitely not recommend.
reviews.title: Tired, shabby, tiny cramped room....would not return

reviews.text: I stayed in a twin room with my Mum (visiting from UK) for a few days in March while we had a browse around Melbourne. We got a free bus transfer from the airport to the hotel. It's not in the city CBD itself but only a very short (and quintessentially Melbournian) tram ride to Flinders St station.
reviews.title: Great position, quiet, a little tired

likes.disliked: — rooms a bit basic - nowhere to relax but the bed

reviews.text: It's also a not unreasonable walk to the city through the gorgeous Fitzroy Park. Coming back from our visits into the city each day we'd sometimes get off a stop early and walk through the park and it's magnificent avenues of Elm trees.
reviews.title: Bedbugs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The B&B is (was) a lovely old building in a nice tree lined terraced street - the suburb is genteel and feels safe to walk around at night.
reviews.title: Quiet & clean, would stay there again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are pretty basic (we paid extra for an adjoining bathroom). The decor is a bit tired and some of the paint finishes were flaking away but as a place to lay our hats at the end of a day spent exploring the city is was totally adequate.
reviews.title: Steer clear...

aka: Georgian Court Bed & Breakfast Guest House Hotel Melbourne
